You have to look really well WHERE on the beach you end up, ie it is mostly depending on the hotel...if these are not directly on the beach, the way there can sometimes seem disenchanting. I didn't like the beach very much, compared for example with Talalla, Dickwela, Tangalle or Hikkaduwa
This beach is a dream September is not yet a high season so the beach was almost empty You could walk great on the beach

column8: Lovely beach with great views and swimming
column11: Really lovely beach with a wide variety of options for day time activities. One main designated swimming area which can get VERY busy with locals but still nice and then mostly private swimming areas for the hotels on the beach which were in-forced by police who at times did seem to be stopping people going to the private beaches based on assumption due to race which was a little uncomfortable to watch.
Great beach, clean and not especially crowded. Stong current depending on weather and season but the beach is guarded.

column8: Wonderful beach experience that one will always cherish.
column11: Amazing beach. The bay provides shallow and virtually pool like basin of sea water creating a very safe bathing spot. Water was not only calm but as warm and was virtually still with very mild waves.

Anyone who describes Pasikudah as unreservedly dreamlike and paradise-like may have arrived by taxi, walked through the lobby of a noble hotel and spent their stay exclusively on the hotel's own, staff-maintained, beach section. However, anyone who walks away from this just a few meters away will be horrified by the mountains of garbage in the landscape. Anyone who now assumes that this is due to tourism or pollution of the world's oceans, i.e. washed-up garbage, only has to walk along the public beach once in the evening to find that unfortunately the population itself makes a significant contribution to the destruction of this paradise. Very sad and depressing!

Fantastic beach, with white sand and, in this period, almost deserted. You just have to pay a little attention to the pieces of coral when entering the water, so rubber slippers are recommended to avoid cutting yourself. Compared to other beaches in Sri Lanka it is extremely clean, with total absence of litter. The only flaw, it is frequented mainly by Resort guests, but towards evening it comes alive with fishermen preparing to enter the sea. A part is free and above all frequented by locals. To see!

This beach is very large and very calm. On one side we go to a quiet and uncrowded area and on the other, towards the public beach. The water is very warm and relatively calm. A pleasure to be peaceful.

Very beautiful beach filled with small crab ðŸ¦€ very warm and relatively clear water. Very pleasant fine sand. The only small problem is when you move away from the hotel beaches you find a lot of plastic waste.
What a terrible place, only expensive resorts with private beaches. There's really nothing here that's inviting. 100km north or south is much more pleasant.
Excellent & enjoyable stay. The service & food was great. Priya at the Reception Desk was very helpful & courteous.

just a few kilometres from Pasikuda Bay lies Kalkudah beach, a 4km long stretch of sand that is the vision of serenity. Kalkudah beach is the less-frequented neighbour of Pasikuda Bay, providing much the same experiences as the latter. We can enjoy with board raiding and bathing for best places

Pasikuda beach is beautiful. I went for my honeymoon to Malu Malu resort and spa where we went on snorkeling. You will find a Varity of beautiful fish in different sizes and colours. The guides are very helpful.

This beach is absolutlely amazing. It deep blue ocean and clear sand make this beach one of the prettiest I have visited so far. The water is hot and almost with any waves, much more like a lake. Some areas have some dead coral so be careful with your feet. Loved it and higly recommend a visit to it.
Very quiet. Only a few hotels. Shallo water. Soft white sand. Some watersports but otherwise not much activity or dining possibilities.

Just back from Sri lanka, where we stayed in Anantaya resort on Passikudah beach.  As I mentioned in a previous review for Arugam bay, it was of season and they are recovering from being closed for 2 years for Covid. Positives: The resort is really beautiful and its situated on a magnificent beach. The people at the resort could not have been any friendlier and helpful. The upgrade they gave us had a swim up pool right to our room, which was fab. The resort is really a 5 start resort and it felt like that staying there. Food was very varied and really good Less positive feedback There was no more than 10 people at the resort while we were there, which made it feel empty. Most of the bars and restaurants that were advertised were closed. (only 1 was open) They set up a temp restaurant and bar, so when people were finished dinner it then closed. (around 8pm) We knew it would be off season, but didnt realise it would be so quiet, especially in the evening. I would certainly recommend Anantaya resort and Passikudah as a fantastic destination, but plan your visit between May and September, when all the facilities should be open.
The beach area it's very good for swimming. I recommend to use the resorts area of the beach, where it's much cleaner and safe.
Superb beach Serene environment Safe and nice beach to have a bath Itâ€™s hardly polluted and itâ€™s a clean beach
Not crowded and a very shallow beach, you can really walk out a long way until it gets beep. Water is a very pretty color and it looks like a pst card. Very nice.
just great for swimming, depth increases gradually and easy to get behind the waves. Warm and crystal clear - a wonderful beach

Tragically, the public part of beach is full of garbage. The 5* hotels take care of the rest of the beach, so those parts are really nice. Sad that this is the case, but Sri Lanka has a terrible litter problem on most of the beaches.
Wide and long stretch of clean soft sand! A must visit if you love the beach . Best to visit during October.
The beach was quite muddy when we visited in early October 2021. However, it was not at all crowded and serene so it was relaxing.

Wonderfull beach and safe sea-bathing place at East Coast in Sri Lanka When we go to the east coast in Sri Lanka, we always select Pasikudha beach for sea-bathing and relaxing at the beach. The beach is clean. This warm blue sea is calm (during April in our experience) and can enjoy swimming safely.
Definitely the east cost of Sri Lanka is wonderful. Sea like a lake, sand superb.... Just donâ€™t loose it.
Passikudah is well known for its tourist resorts and calm beach with shallow water. Most big resorts have their own private beaches.
Nice hot water at this season . There is a barreer of corail which cut the waves . You can see lot of fish

One of the best place to have a sea bathe, If you love sandy beaches with shallow sea, this beach might be a good choice. The sea waves aren't that nicer compared to other beaches in Sri Lanka. but if you are looking to have asafe sea bathe this is definitely recommended. The best time for bathe in this place would be between 9 am until 2 pm as this place get crowded in the evenings.
It is not beautiful as it used to be. Except the areas maintained by the hotels rest is not eye catching. Yet it is a good place to relax
Passikudah Beach is a nice place to visit if you want to relax. The water is pretty clear and not too deep. I'd recommend visiting if you want to go to a beach in Sri Lanka.

Probably not the best of Sri Lankan beaches but still a nice spot. The middle of the cove is the best as the ends are rocky and the one section that seems to be frequented by locals has garbage strewn about. The rest of the beach is pretty clean. The sand is powdery and the water is clear. Downside if you arenâ€™t staying at one of the beach resorts is that there is zero shade. All trees and structures are on private property and there is security to make sure you donâ€™t even sit under a tree on the border of resort and beach. Easy to burn fast!
I had a very pleasant experience at the beach .Its a safe & enjoyable beach for family & children & friends .

Sea is nice with sandy beach,life guards are present but too many crows and dogs on the beach,you can also see little fish in the water ,may be january not the best month to visit as some days the sea is rough
The beach is wide, the sand is warm and the Indian Ocean is hard to beat. Offers a lovely experience. We saw the sunrise, and the sky turned pink at sunset. This is an amazing beach

December is not the season - but very good place to relax and enjoy the nature. Beach was a clean to a certain extent and a place and good for sea bath. Of course we had great pleasure in visiting the place. its a 6 hour dive from colombo - but worth it.

Great beach all round. Water not deep. No big waves because of the reef. You have to get used to the shells & coral pieces lying on the sand under water. other than this this is a fantastic place for a sea bath.

An absolutely beautiful stretch of beach, with a shallow entry and warm waters to enjoy. It was a bit rough when we visited, but not at all unswimable (3-4â€™ waves). The heavy surf did product a thick belt of shells, coral and other items at the entry, and a somewhat deep drop at the shore (which quickly levels off), making getting in or out tricky and uncomfortable on the feet. The only major negative was the amount of waste, plastics and other random debris in the ocean. It was an ugly situation, and detracted from the natural splendour of the place. Sad the people would be so shortsighted and not respect the beautiful surroundings.

Stayed in a bungalow, there are only a few overlooking the ocean. I cannot believe how tranquil this place was. You can get a sea plane back to Colombo if you donâ€™t want the long journey back.  It was Feb. 2018 not 19 cannot wait to return before the area becomes built up.
Great beach where you can bring children for a swim. Protected by the reef and can walk up to 100 metres into the ocean,only waist deep.

Whilst staying at Amethyst Resort from 1st to 3rd December 2019, we enjoyed the Pasikudah beach and the walks along the clean white sandy beach.  During the recent floods, overflowing waters from an adjacent canal had brought in some aquatic plants on to the beach.  Cleaning of these was under way. The notices on the beach requested each visitor to collect two plastic items on each visit and dispose them at collection points.  Though it was the rainy monsoon season, there were many youngsters frolicking and swimming in safe areas in the sea with lifeguards watching them from their vantage high station.  I saw a family with a little kid building stupas on sand.  Youngsters were playing beach volleyball.  There were some collecting seashells on the beach.

Beautiful beach with a lot charm, local fishermen in their traditional boats are great to see and on the side of the beach you the locals area which is also fantastic to experience, what about cricket on the beach!!!

Passikudah is one of the best beaches in the eastern coast having breathtaking views. If you are looking at places to stay, I would reccommend Uga bay and Anilana hotels as they provide exceptional service.
Huge expanse of clean white sand and a long long beach. Perfect for running along the edge of the waves, sunbathing, playing beach volleyball or just walking slowing taking in the beauty of it all.
Excellent beach,Very clean and long one.Great for swimming and viewing corals. Perfect for family trip.
I was looking forward and had a wish for dip and leisure in the calm and shallow waters of Passikudah Bay, with gentle waters lapping at my body â€“ enjoyed thoroughly  this was really awesome
The perfect beach experience for me. Love this place and I visit at least twice a year. Great for swimming, and perfect for family vacations.
The beach was actually better than the grass that the hotel considered beach. Went for a walk here at sunset and view lovely
Pasikudah beach is amazing. Calm shallow waters. You can hire a glass bottom boat to see corals. White sand beach is clean. On a clear day sunrise in the morning is very colorful.
Simply awesome!!! What more can I say. White sandy beaches with calm waters like that of a swimming pool. Water is clean and one can venture into the sea for some distance without any worry.
This beach is like a swimming pool at this time of the year! Very shallow, warm and calm.the beach sand is nice to walk along and there are spots close-by for snorkeling.

Passikudah Beach is a beach with very different faces. Beginning with many corals, then flat and sandy, as any tourist wants to have, then mixed with corals and sand, and in the end, at elephant rock, with huge rocks. You must take your time to explore, it's worth it. Make a long walk, or, just go there for sunrise, it's really amazing, I'm still in love with it.

Nice place to have a safe swim, better time to swim or be there morning before sun get heat up....nice beach clean and neat....prefer days should be weekdays...if weekend or holidays bit crowded....overall nice venue to swim and enjoy even with family or friends.
Really a nice beach, nice wheather on summer time... lots of hotels are there... just enjoy the beach

Pasikudah beach is a nice place to visit. Be carefull if you go on the weekend because it's very crowdy of local people. Even that, you can walk a little bit and be alone because all the locals are gathered in the same place.
Super customer care done by priya & taniya. Nice plz to chill out ðŸ˜Š. Food variety on buffet is expected level plus morning one is delicious.

Picturesque beach. Vey clean and very safe to bathe. Best time to go to beach is morning. Evening is also good however during mid day towards noon is little difficult to bare the very warm conditions.

If you have very small childern than I rather recommend Passikudah Beach where is low water even if you walk 50 m to the ocean. But if you travel without childern, never go to Passikudah Beach - it is boring, it is more difficult go to swimm there. Definitely chose Kalkudah Beach where the ocean has beautiful color, it is easy to go to swim and there are almost no people on the beach.
The passikuda beach is the best in srilanka we stayed at maalu Maalu hotel the beach there was excellent and our kids enjoyed the water sports

We recently spent 4 days in this area and Passikudah beach is lovely. It is nice and clean as a beach and the water is also clean and clear. It is shallow for miles out so great for a relaxing hangout and swim. We made it a ritual to stop here everyday for a bit. Gets a little busy on weekends but not unnameable.
There are shoals of fish that actually leap amongst the swimmers! Iâ€™ve taken shots of them - and will at so we time later, when I have the time, upload these shots.
Had a great time at the Amaya Beach resort! Loved the quiet and clean beaches, however not many restaurants  outside of the hotels. Snorkling possible .
Not a crowded beach and no salesmen are trying to sell souveniers. Watersports i.e. jetski. Plenty of place to relax. And you feel very safe here.
A safe (enclosed in a lagoon) sea to swim in, and a beautiful large white beach which is not crowded!
Sand and beautiful water, cooling wind and nice people! Jet ski available for the teenagers and nice sandwich bars for lunch.ðŸ˜„ðŸ˜Ž
Best beach I've visited in Sri Lanka. Clean white sand and crystal clear water. You can walk quite a ways into the ocean.

The part of Passikudah Beach we had access to from the Amethyst Resort was lovely.  Water is extremely calm and warm.  You have to walk out quite a long way to get to deeper water so fairly safe.  Protected by a reef.  Not many tourists as yet, but good to see the local people enjoying the water.
Lovely long, wide beach lined with resorts but it also has public access. Only downside is that there's little shade and no loungers/parasols to hire on the beach itself.
Really enjoyed Pasikudah beach during my stay in June, 2019. I stayed at Uga Bay and it was well maintained, and well guarded. The sea is very nice and calm.
One of the best beaches to sunbathe and swim. Water isnt deep for long stretch into the sea.Not many fish in the shallows though.

Passikudah Beach is one of the best in Sri Lanka. It's so attractive, calm, has beautiful white sand. There are good quality 4-5* hotels around. It's so peaceful,  no disturbance from beach boys.  We enjoyed swimming, had perfect relaxation.  Perfect time to travel from May to September.
What a beach... true paradise , the sand is white,white... itâ€™s so peacefull! We love it here! Weâ€™ll come back here fore sure!!
It's a nice beach to visit with family including children and enjoy sea bath and other sports activities.

Very beautiful beach in eastern cost, little north of Batticaloa Town. It's clean and always there are hotel staff to remove the  coral parts from the beach. specially in the morning. Nice view to see the rising sun in the morning.

Has to be one of the nicest resort beaches on the Island. A long stretch of lovely golden sands, Azure calm waters that you can wade quite a distance out into. Great beach for long walks early in the morning or at sunset. Avoid the section of public beach towards the southern end, its noisy and overcrowded. Great for diving, snorkeling and you can also hire Jet Skiis. One thing Passikuda lacks is a bit of the outside restaurant and bar scene. Perhaps they can allocate a specific area at the back of the resort for this.

Water is calm so good for swimming with children. Lovely sandy beach with shade. Got moved on by security guards when we tried to sit under a tree in front of a resort. Stalls in car park selling inflatable rings and balls.
Nice beach and not too busy, Very clean. Top place to spend several days in peace. This was one of best options we chose. Unforgettable experience, highly recommended.

We stayed in a hotel 5-10 minutes walk from our hotel's private beach to the public beach of Pasikudah. It's breathtakingly beautiful and I would highly recommend a visit. We also booked a snorkelling trip with one of the boatman who took us to elephant rock where we saw coral and colourful fish. Would recommend a visit to this beach
The sand is very fine. Just aa fine as in Bretagne, France. The water is way warmer than in Bretagne. No cold sensation when getting in. The waves are very moderate. It is not crowded at all.
A nice place and beach to visit. Little over crowded during weekends and holidays but still you would be able to find a peacefull place to bathe if you walk a little further on shore.
Many people come to this place as it's safe, carm place to have a bath Need to replant coral as all of those are dead No need to pay for entering

I stayed at a hotel in Passikudah which had a beach in from and sandy sands. Excellent hotel with a swimming pool but, could not swim in the beach opposite the hotel as it had corals. same with four other adjoining hotels.  Hence had to end up swimming in the public beach which was extremely noisy  Thus warning guests who intend to go to Passikudah should check from the hotel they are booking whether you can swim at the beach adjacent to the hotel and if it is coral free? Hotels which have corals in the beach and guest unable to swim are ANILANA/ ANANTAYA/PASSI VILLAS/ SUN AQUA  . Was very disappointed.Trip advisor reviews too do not mention the at all.. Hence you ought to contact the hotel directly and verify whether they have coral free beaches before making the booking.

We spent wonderful 2 days at the passikudah beach and I would say this is a five star beach. Beach is incredibly Clean blue colour and calm so  even kids can enjoy. Beach is broad and sandy which is beautified by palm trees. There are few beautiful hotels that you can easily access to the beach. We wanted to experience the east coast and this was one of best options we chose.
December is a high tide season for Passikuda. Therefore there was nothing much to do around the beach. But there are quite a good number of hotels for people who are looking for a relaxing holiday.
Lovely beach with several hotels in the area.  The water is clean, calm and safe to swim in.  There are not many restaurants in the area so dining is fairly limited to hotel restaurants.
Great place to spend the time of Sun Rise or Sun Set. The shallow sea spread over more than 100 metres where kids can enjoy too. No waives at all, just like a pool.
We used this beach whilst staying at the Calm Resort complex. Nice, sandy beach with shallow sea for quite a way out. The Indian Ocean here is the warmest sea I have ever swum in.

Pasikudah has regained its status as a popular tourist destination after the end of the insurrections in 2009 and after the completion of Tsunami rehabilitation projects. Pasikudah is known to have one of the longest stretches of shallow coastline. Visitors walk kilometers into the sea which is not that deep and the current is relatively low compared to the other beaches. There are many star class hotels in operation and many are being built. Pasikudah can be reached from Batticaloa and Trincomalee along the A15 road parallel to the coastline, and also from Polonnaruwa on the A11 road. During the seasons, many water sports players from many countries come to enjoy the waves in Pasikudha Beach. Even Sri Lankan players compete with them. Pasikudha beach is ideal for beginners in water surfing. Open tournaments are held at the Pasikuda beach during the season for surfers. The sea is visualized with crystal clear water. Foreign travelers never miss this beach as it is well known as an ideal destination for a sea bath, and throughout the year the beach is fully crowded with travelers from all around the world.
The beach was clean, sandy and empty. There was a red flag both days so swimming in the sea wasn't an option.
Beautiful beach, calm seas, warm water and the security was a real bonus for peace of mind, although this wasn't ever needed.
The pasikuda beach was excellent. Itâ€™s like one big swimming pool. Felt very safe for the kids too. Donâ€™t miss walking towards the fishing boats in the morning to check their daily catch
Excellent sandy beach with good infrastructure. Beach is cleaned every day. I recommend for everyone.

Between April and October Pasikudha Beach is at its best.  Hotels on the beach are mostly high-end, but there are many guest houses in the close proximity too.  There are no independent small restaurents on the beach like in Unawatuna/ Hikkaduwa & Mirissa. It is a beautiful beach to be on during the season. During the off-season, the sea is a bit rough to bath, but the beach still remains wonderful!
Very Nice beach where the water was very hot and not too much  on the beach...this was really appreciated
Very beautiful beach with a lot of crabs, various types of shells and fish. Perfect fine sand and crystal clear water....
calm beach for a safe sea bathing and monitored by life savers and Police to keep the tranquility and safety.
This is a great white sand beach with beautiful palm trees on both sides.  Itâ€™s a wide beach and there are lots of resorts with cafeâ€™s all along
Nice and clean. No rubbish and very clean water. Only resorts on this stretch, but wide spread. Very relaxed. (no crowds)

Thought the sea is rough when I was there, it is obvious that the beach is a perfect combination of surf like features and family type features. There are places where you can enjoy a nice time with your family in the beach while other areas offer much better conditions for surfing, etc. This beach is much cleaner from the other beaches I know thus makes the whole experience much more pleasant.
Good for a relaxing holiday. This area is really good for family outings. There are plenty of beach hotels in Pasikudah.

We had a lovely walk the whole length of the beach.  Only the section near the car park was busy with locals and most of the hotels guests sun bathe in the hotel gardens so the beach it self was quiet.
Passikudah is a great beach located in the east of Sri Lanka. Easy and comfortable road access is available from  Colombo. Safety is great though out the journey.
Well worth a visit to Passikuda beach. Can do glass bottom boat trips out on the boat to check on the corals. Will look to visit this place again.
Great beach just to chill out. Very clean and it was like a spa. Many good hotels along the beach. Malumalu Resort provides great service by the beach
Great beach with lovely sand and crystal clear water... however not much sea life. Lovely walks up and down the beach for hours.
nice place to be with family. good, clean, and fantastic service from the staff.  nice beach bar with authentic cocktails.

Generally we have been saddened by how badly polluted the beaches on the east coast of Sri Lanka are but Pasikudah beach is generally better than most. Just donâ€™t walk all the way to the southern end which is a bit of a mess
This is the best beach available in Eastern side of the country. Very safe for sea bath. The beach is spreaded all along around one kilometre. So there are lots of opportunities to enjoy.

We came here in October, everything looks pretty deserted and packed up for the season. Food in the hotels extremely expensive, couple of places on the street between Pasikuda and Kalkudah beach, but hard to get fresh seafood. Probably better to come here in the season (June, July, August) to get better weather.
Awsome place for sea bath. Enjoyed a calm and beautiful beach. Hope to visit again. Perfect place for sea bath also for water sports too. Can enjoy the beach from sunrise to sunset.
We spend a week at this beach. Its very clean and the water is absolutely clear. If you like to walk on the beach this is the place to be.
One of the best beaches in Sri Lanka. Specially for snorkeling. Loved every bit of time I spent there :)
Good beach with good view for sunrise. Has options for jet ski. Not too crowded. Has good resorts along the beach where you can stay.
Great walking along the friendly beach . Smile with the locals. Watch the stars at night. Peek into the other hotels along the front .
There are nice hotels by the beach. The beach has a common park where many people would come for the day.

Our hotel had direct access to this beach and it was beautiful. Others told me that the further you walked along the beach there was a lot of rubbish but I never saw this. A variety of water sports were available.
An amazing beach. Soft sands, clear and calm waters, very few tourists and friendly cows. Perfect for swimming and long walks. We loved it.
Beautiful quiet beach, Hope it stays like like this and doesnâ€™t get over developed. Walk down to the edge of the beach and see the intriguing fishermanâ€™s huts
Literally perfect - white sand, turquoise sea. Jet skiing, and donuts available but really empty beautiful beach.  The opposite of the crowded European beaches in August

The beach is beautiful, white sand and clean sea infront of the hotels, after the hotels the beach is not as well kept and some areas full of coral. The weather was on in August, however, what we were not told is that there are high winds in August, with upto 25kmph which was every day and ruined the tranquility a bit as walking down the beach we were sand blasted.

The beach has soft sand and you can walk out for a fair distance as the water is shallow. It is clean and not many people. The resorts have areas of the beach so if you have a drink or a meal at the hotel you can use that part of the beach.
Clean and fresh beach. You can walk along without being â€œhammeredâ€ by salesmen and wild dogs. Very pleasant. Great to swim during of  monsoon season.

Amazing paradise beach! Warm clear water and white sand! Biggest drawback of this beach is that it is clearly aimed at families and people who are there to spend some money! We came as backpackers looking for a relaxing stay and found that our hotel was cheap, but everything else was expensive! Pros Safe and secure, security guards It is beautiful!! Amazing sunshine Nice beach restaurants Peaceful area away from the road Beach activities available Cons Very windy, uncomfortable amount of sand in your face! All beds are owned by hotels for only paying guests! No shade, canâ€™t even lie under a tree as it is hotel owned Beach resorts own most of beach, 2m from shore is where the â€˜non payersâ€™ can go! Were told the resorts â€œdonâ€™t want non payers too close to the guestsâ€ Hired beach beds for 900rupees from uga bay resort after negotiation! Were only alowed them until hotel guests arrived and no one was allowed to open up the accompanying umbrellas! We were made to feel very uncomfortable!! Only available food is from local shops or beach resorts! Resorts are lovely but very expensive! Overall backpackers and people on a tighter budget avoid! Nice place for families and honeymooners! Bring your wallet!!!
Really nice bay with sandy beaches. There are many hotels in the bay and a small town near by. I recommend to go there if you are visiting the east coast.
A clean beach with a lot of activites to do. Water is calm and the surrounding is well kept.however some of the activities available may leave a dent in your wallet(specially the sail boat ride)

The beach is very clean and the water itâ€™s hot, you can play jet ski, wakeboard, diving, snorkeling, banana...! Itâ€™s a very fun place with many kind of people... there is a bit of wind all day long! Very good!
The middle to northern part of the beach is much better than the south where there is too much coral and too many people.
Beautiful beach, white sand, warm sea and not very many people on the beach. Lots of water activities which is great fun. Was beautiful and would definitely recommended
Most incredible beach. Clean, basically empty and lovely soft sand. Amazing find and recommend thoroughly

A beautiful beach with lovely safe swimming. We stayed at Maalu Maalu so had the use of the beach right outside the hotel but you can walk the entire length of the beach whichnisnlovely to do early morning or evening.
Clean and calm beach, great for taking a swim or a morning run along the bay. Also ideal for morning yoga during sunrise and beach volleyball.

Passikudah beach charm is in the fact that there are no crowds and you can have a lonely romantic walk at sunset or sunrise. The main entrance next to Analuya is a swimming place for locals - worth seeing the local families there. You can walk along the beach for 15#20 min. Some parts are full of corals, others - some garbage. The beach is part of the lagoon protected by coral reef and some people do snorkeling here as there are little waves within lagoon. Little activuties other than swimming and almost no shops. All in all it is a beautiful place

We live in the USA and can only visit Sri Lanka during our summer school holidays so we always go to Passikudah beach in June or July.  The beach is beautiful and extremely clean.  I love the fact that you can walk far out into the water at this time of year and there is no strong current and itâ€™s not deep. The beach is the best behind Anantaya, Maalu Maalu and Uga Bay.  However, if you go to the beach behind Anilana, it is terrible and you really canâ€™t go into the water because all of the sand is covered with broken coral fragments.  I love Anilana hotel, but not the beach behind it. Donâ€™t miss the wonderful sunrise on Pasikudah beach. In addition, take a walk down to the fishing village at the end of the beach in the early morning hours just after sunrise as that is when the fisherman pull in their nets. Itâ€™s really interesting to see what they catch. Also keep in mind the water on this beach is calmest during June to September and it is really rough December through March.
Fabulous very clean and neat east cost  beach for every one to enjoy. Specially for water sports and relax. For nature lovers too can enjoy .
Incredible beach - water so warm and clean. Such a pity about plastic bottles etc strewn across the sand.

Passikudah beach is the classic beach paradise...with lovely white sand, bath-warm water and fringed with palms. Itâ€™s a big bay where a busy public beach (we were there on the full moon public holiday)  sits happily alongside the quieter, hotel frontages. Only improvement would be to extend the exclusion zone for jet skis- although hardly an issue as only a couple are available, they would be better kept 100m or more offshore - they do break the peaceful setting and hamper a long swim out from the beach.

Beautiful beach ðŸ– Quite a few big hotels use this beach and I believe you can use some of their beach bars. It is kept very clean and police were seen patrolling the beach. The sea is very clear and safe to swim in. It is quite shallow until quite a way out. There is a PADI Dive School on the beach which also rents jet skiâ€™s, banana boat rides etc. My daughter did her PADI Open Water Qualfication whilst we were there and they were very professional and my daughter enjoyed diving with them.

Realy lovely beach...calm and peaceful...beach is really clean water is realy warm great for children becuse water isnt deep about 250m in to the sea. The best part of the beach is in front of The Calm hotel...

We stayed at one of the large resorts, but loved our daily walks along the beach, and seeing all the locals enjoying their beautiful beach. Our 6 month old loved it!! The water was warm, no waves, he could have sat on the shoreline eating sand all day. There are cows and dogs around particularly at the public beach end which has a life guard, but itâ€™s very relaxed. I only hope it can stay clean and not full of jet skis.

Passikudah Beach is one of nicest beaches in the east coast of Sri Lanka. We have visited three beaches in the east coast of Sri Lanka, Nilaveli Beach, Arugambay Beach and Passikudah Beach. Out of all I like Passikudah Beach very much. We have walk along the beach while we were in the Maalu Maalu Resort. It is a very long beach and you can walk miles along the beach. Several Hotels have come up along the beach and the beach is very clean. If you go to the beach in the early morning you could see the sunrise. During the North East Monsoon that is during December to February Wind is coming toward the land from the sea and sea may be fairly rough in the afternoon with the sea breeze and the seas are good for surfing. During the South West Monsoon period that is during May to September seas along the east coast is light. That period is the best period for sea bathing without any risk. November December period is the Cyclonic period and cyclonic storms may form in the Bay of Bengal and may cause very strong winds and very rough seas with rain and showers. If you are going to the beaches in the east coast during November and December better to watch the weather and find out whether there are any cyclone formation in the lower part of Bay of Bengal which may cause very bad weather over the Eastern side of Sri Lanka. Anyone who visit Sri Lanka should visit the Passikuda Beach.

Passikudah Beach has attracted tourists both local and foreign for decades now. The tourism around this beach goes back way before the war that ended in 2009. However, since 2009 there has been much development, rapid in fact that saw and upward pace until it slowed down in 2014. So one has a few good hotels to stay right on the beach while there are guest houses and Inns within walking distance and off of the main road for those on a budget. As for good hotels, Uga Bay comes first to my mind. You cannot go wrong here. Malu Malu is the famous one whose name is synonymous with the word Passikudah but I have not been there to say much about it. The beach in front of Uga Bay is one of the cleanest and well kept and the same could be said about most of the expensive hotels on this beach. For those fans of beaches in California or South Florida, this would be a contrast in culture as one would find neither a like minded crowd nor beach bars lined up along the strip. This is instead a more "private" beach by local standards but it is not exclusively private. I say private simply because it does not have a populous neighborhood in the vicinity. No trains disturbing the tranquility here like in the southern beaches of Sri Lanka and it does make you want to be in it longer. This beach is crystal clear and picture perfect most of the year until the end of the year when the North-Eastern monsoon winds and rain come down hard in this area. It is off-season here beginning October and business begins to slow down as early as September. This is a safe beach with no reputation for ugly incidents so let things be this way. It is ideal for family fun. Enjoy this beach and help keep it clean!

Just a stretch of beach with lots and lots of locals ( if your female I would cover up as much as possible too as the young men arnt used to flesh on show and you'll be stared )water was not clear lots of coral washed up on beach so a bit painfull without flip flops. We basically had to pay 2250 ruppees for use of one of the hotels so we could find shade and privacy and food and drink. Just prewarning you all.
Nice beach . just to watch... the tzunami in 2004 washed away the reef and now there is a strong current and swimming is not suggested. furthermore there are no bars and hotels butthe seen is great.
Lovely unspoilt beach.... at the moment. Lots of hotels being built so would think this will all change in the coming years.

What a wonderful beach. Very busy with locals on Saturday but still space for us. It is backed by several large hotels but there is plenty of open beach to enjoy. Good snorkelling from local boats that don't rip you off. The sister beach of Kalkudah is a gem
We had a super time at the beach. My kids were doing the the water rides done by LSR . The beach was quite empty comparing to the common beach area which was full .

Passikuda beach lies on the east coast of Srilanka serving up gorgeous pristine coastline with golden, sunbaked sand. The water is clear shallow for miles,and offshore you will find some island's best diving-shipwrecked HMS Hermes is of particular note.
The water is very warm, what i like, but there are so many people and so many locals. The water is without waves but nevertheless it's not clear very much.

Really nice beach although a little bit too much wind when we were there ! Water was almost warm and really easy to get in. I warmly recommend to book a 3 hours tour on the catamaran that is anchored in the bay.
The best clean beach I have ever been in the northern part of Sri Lanka. Well kept with soft white sand and very warm water.  My whole family loved it including my young nephews.
Very good place to relax and enjoy the nature. Beach was a clean place and good for sea bath. Of course we had great pleasure in visiting the place.

A safe place to bathe and engage in water sport activities. The police and the life guard people are always around and you feel safe. There is a special LSR sport activity where they take you snorkelling in a Sail boat where you can really enjoy time at sea ! Breath taking views of the corals will amaze you for sure ! A bit sunny and better to take your sun glasses and sun protection cream for protecting your skin. ( more important to foreigners with light skin )

One of the most popular beaches in Sri Lanka. If you are travelling towards Batticaloa, you should visit this place. You can have lovely sea bath here and lots of water sports are available for you like Jet Skis, Diving, Snorkeling, Boat Surfing and wind surfing. Lots of hotels are available for lodging in this area.
